snippet: In Minsk, Europe’s often fractious leaders confronted the reality that President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia retains the upper hand precisely because he is prepared to use military force to get what he wants in diplomacy.
abstract: News Analysis; European leaders gathered in Minsk, Belarus, to discuss Ukrainian conflict acknowledge that Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin, despite his country's economic woes, holds upper hand because he is willing to use military force to get what he wants; other leaders seeking cease-fire are bound by effort to use diplomacy in negotiations.

byline.contributor: Alison Smale contributed reporting from Berlin, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: In Minsk, Europe’s often fractious leaders confronted the reality that President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia retains the upper hand precisely because he is prepared to use military force to get what he wants in diplomacy.
